introduction: This historical documentary showing the events of 1968 in the town of Liberec. August events in 1968 affected the lives and the fate of all citizens of the former Czechoslovakia. After hopes the Prague Spring was cold shower in the form of tanks friendly armies. On that Wednesday morning, the 21st August, the majority of people in shock, nobody knew what will take place in the next minutes, hours and days. Director John Hadkova in its impressive documentary charts the tragic and the important role the city of Liberec in this tense period.It is through this city headed in Poland Warsaw Pact tanks. Shoot here had already begun on a half one night for 21 August. Liberecane responded immediately - zbavovali street names, falsovali traffic indicators and sending occupiers place in Prague in the Jizera Mountains ...Documentary film brings the satisfaction of the atmosphere of those days in Liberec - moments of hopelessness, despair, cruelty and heroism of ordinary people.
